column4: I think ubuntu is throttling my CPU when this laptop is plugged in
you can add cpu frequency applet to the taskbar and set the behaviour
HAve a dualcore here and added two applets, chose on one cpu0 on the other cpu1 and can also set the mode with a click on it
which app is that?
right click the upper taskbar and choose add to panel
then go down until you see something like monitor cpu-frequency, have another locale than english here, so it can be named otherwise :)
I'm using XFCE and that XFCE one doesn't actually control it... are you using gnome?
yeah, I use gnome
hhhm, good question :)
right click it and hit "About"
as I said, using another language than english :(
think cpufreq-applet, thats at least what appears as task
yeah, confirmed, I killed it to try and the applets disappeared :)
can you do this? dpkg --search cpufreq-applet
did it already, didn'T come up with a result
gonna pastebin it
http://pastebin.com/ZRYUdTd4
will probably load also some other dependencies of gnome
well, it's also with some nice KDE stuff, I really liked kate and sometimes installed it, and this pulled some kde-packages as well ;)
mabye this can help http://goodies.xfce.org/projects/panel-plugins/xfce4-xfapplet-plugin
you can set it to powersave or performance and so on, neat :)
np
you remember my slow VM performance from the other day?
turns out, there is a sysctl tweak you can make with the scheduler that increases performance a whole ton
